name: Omron HJ-321 Hip Pedometer With Holder

reviews.name: Omron HJ-321 Hip Pedometer With Holder
reviews.reviewText:
I have my second pedometer now. The first one was lost. Apparently there is no way to secure the unit to your clothing. Nothing is included. So I improvised and failed to note that the holding clip is too small for a normal belt, and does not securely hold the unit if brushed by clothing. Surely a lanyard of some sort with a clip on it should be included with the purchase. Sort of a pricy lesson.
Other then that the unit does seem to work fine. The instructions could be streamlined just a bit. The included ones are way to wordy.
reviews.title: some thoughts

reviews.name: Omron HJ-321 Hip Pedometer With Holder
reviews.reviewText: This is very simple to operate. Just read the manual for easy setup instructions and go. I don't know if the readings are accurate, but I see it as a day-by-day comparison of my activity. Just keep steps above 10000 per day for a person my age for reasonable activity. It measures calories, aerobic steps, step pitch, etc, and saves all for a running 7 day record. It resets numbers automatically daily. The only slight complaint I have is the units display is small for my aging eyes.
reviews.title: I Think it's great!

reviews.name: Omron HJ-321 Hip Pedometer With Holder
reviews.reviewText: I sent the first one back after buying batteries in the event the one that came with the unit was weak. The second unit, the same as the first, can't be set. The instructions are simple incomprehensible and don't work.
reviews.title: horrible example of terrible instructions

reviews.name: Omron HJ-321 Hip Pedometer With Holder
reviews.reviewText: Simple to setup, works reliably, good value, just works.
reviews.title: Does what it says on the tin
